figgy.title: Document deletion and preservation policies / behavior

comments.body:
> Questions that need answered:
> 
> Is there a small thing we can do to close this ticket and iterate that bypasses that caption requirement? For instance - is it enough to ingest the video, make it playable, but not render it for non-staff.
> How does someone request captions?

- no one would be requesting captions from us.  They would be providing us captions. this is someone else's responsibility. Captions for video should be required for completion of an object in figgy not marked as "Private" visibility. Minimum metadata is required before ingest or completion of objects in figgy as a best practice. Captions for video should be just as important, if not moreso, due to legal ramifications for their absence. 

> When requesting captions, what happens?

- We can offer the names of up to three vendors for them or suggest the workflow provided by Barbara here...
> How fast do captions need to turn around in?

- without captions, objects should not marked as anything but "Private" visibility. Turnound time will be dependent on the primary stakeholder.

> What kind of captions do we support?

- format mentioned by @tpendragon : vtt (and/or?? srt?? scc?? ttml?? )
- Language(s)/Script(s): Multi lingual collections are being proposed. 

> How do we model captions in Figgy? Presumably it's a separate file - how do we say that the video "1.mp4" is linked to the caption "1-caption.vtt", if there can be multiple videos in a single ScannedResource

- This would be a cataloging questions as much as an ingest question. For multiple tapes/cds, would it be ingested as a MVW? or would a different workflow  be necessary for video (and audio?)?

> If a video gets uploaded without an associated caption file, what should Figgy do? Prevent marking complete? Prevent marking anything but private?

- Only Private option as default.  Get user/administration feedback on completion question.  If there are no captions, are we willing to still provide access via VRR/OARSC for the private material? If so, completion of private video with no captions would be allowed. 

> For video that HAS no audio (silent films), what's best practice for captions? Do we still need a caption that says there's no audio or something, or is it just not an issue?

- needs research but @escowles mentioned "No Linguistic Content" as a best practice/option for this use case

> Where are we going to put all these derivatives? The Isilon? That's where audio derivatives are, but the performance is slow and videos are a lot bigger. Do we need to store and stream these from the cloud?

- discuss cloud

> We need a video WITH captions to test with.

- Forthcoming
UPDATE:  If we had our choice, we would want to implement this in Ephemera more than Scanned Resource. It would better serve the current use cases.

> How do we model captions in Figgy? Presumably it's a separate file - how do we say that the video "1.mp4" is linked to the caption "1-caption.vtt", if there can be multiple videos in a single ScannedResource

One way to model this would be to attach the caption files to the same FileSet as the video file, using the mime type and/or use attributes to identify them as caption files. This would let you have multiple video files in a single ScannedResource and keep the captions attached to the correct video files.

figgy.title: Clear out previous violations of unique constraint on current events
Write integration tests for all of our restoration scenarios from our fire drills

comments.body:
I just hit a problem since upgrading to postgres 15 locally where running rails server and hitting the database caused a segmentation fault. Adding `export PGGSSENCMODE="disable"` to my zshrc resolved it. there are issues in the pg repo, e.g. https://github.com/ged/ruby-pg/issues/538

I also had to update my vim-test configuration like:
```
nnoremap <Leader>a :TestSuite PGGSSENCMODE=disable<CR>
nnoremap <Leader>t :TestFile PGGSSENCMODE=disable<CR>
nnoremap <Leader>n :TestNearest PGGSSENCMODE=disable<CR>
nnoremap <Leader>l :TestLast PGGSSENCMODE=disable<CR>
```

```
figgy_production=# SELECT COUNT(*) FROM orm_resources a JOIN orm_resources b ON ((a.metadata->'resource_id'->0->>'id')::UUID = (b.metadata->'resource_id'->0->>'id')::UUID) WHERE a.internal_resource = 'Event' AND a.metadata @> '{"type":["cloud_fixity"],"current":[true],"child_property":["metadata_node"]}' AND b.internal_resource = 'Event' AND b.metadata @> '{"type":["cloud_fixity"],"current":[true],"child_property":["metadata_node"]}' AND a.id != b.id;
 count 
-------
 10424
(1 row)
```

princeton_ansible.title: Pass HTML error codes for abid-staging through the LB

comments.body:
Today we got this partially working. The necessary fixes/changes include:
1. add the `proxy_intercept_errors on;` directive in the `location` block of the site config (our test site config is `abid-staging`)
2. remove or comment out the inclusion of `/etc/nginx/conf.d/templates/staging-maintenance.conf` - this was active and working but uses the old syntax, and you can't have two `error_page` definitions 
3. include `/etc/nginx/conf.d/templates/errors.conf` - not sure if this should be in the `location` block or in the `server` block, right now it's in both
4. on the load balancer, copy `/var/local/www/default/index.html` (which is the deployed file created from the `roles/nginx/files/www/error.html` file) to `/var/local/www/default/error.html` (which is what the errors.conf file is looking for), with the correct permissions
5. add a specific error code you want to return, using `=XXX`, after the list of error codes to capture, in `errors.conf` (on the LB I set it to `=503`, in the git branch I've set it to `=500`)

With these changes, I consistently get the right results:
 - at the command line:
```
alicia@PULaptop ~ % curl -I https://abid-staging.princeton.edu
HTTP/2 503 
server: nginx/1.23.4
date: Mon, 31 Jul 2023 22:51:53 GMT
content-type: text/html
```
- in the browser:
![Screenshot 2023-07-31 at 6 05 52 PM](https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible/assets/879121/adbfa335-51b4-4911-a8a4-2b96a67f29ef)

Still not sure how to get the LB to pass "whatever the upstream error code is", but we're closer!
Awesome, look forward to hearing more about this. For step 5, does pass-through work if you use the plain `=` instead of, e.g., `=503`?
FYI for folks upgrading to 15 in development environments, see https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/pull/5918#issuecomment-1660571628 for a gotcha (with fix).
